intro: Echinacea atrorubens var. neglecta, commonly known as the black root coneflower, is a perennial herb native to the central and eastern United States. It is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers and dark red to black roots, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional use in herbal medicine.
